div.p: From Bertha Doughty to Clara Wehl
RB MSS number, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

Transcribed 23.3.89. To proof.
St. Helens, August 18th 1857.

"My good George went yesterday morn to Melbourne to buy Store cattle, I shall not see him for a fortnight, so long have we not been parted before. Mrs. Montry has kindly promised to stay with me during that time. You cannot think what a dear sweet little boy Georgie is, & so sensible; to everything he sees he talks in his own baby way, & if it is only to a nail in the door or a thread moving in a draft. Do you remember the little figure I have, representing Frederick the Great ? he looks it always streight in the face & talks to it till he gets so excited, that we have to take it away. He has been short coated for some weeks & wears long flannell Nightgowns. Generally he is put on his bed with open eyes.
